association of co-morbidities alone does not seem to be responsible for complications or aberrant immune response. absence of viremia in both patient categories and relatively low viral load in the lung aspirates suggests enhanced replication of the virus may not be an important contributor to the pathogenesis. significantly higher titres of IgG-anti-p-H1N1-09 antibodies in critically ill patients supports the role in pathogenesis. this observation correlates with elevated levels of TLR3, 4, and 7, Th2 cytokines (IL6 and IL10) at protein level. down-regulation of a large number of genes was associated with disease severity. this profile is indicative of massive infiltration of monocyte-recruited neutrophils, DCs/macrophages to the target organ for mounting immune
